title: How to Choose Cakes for an Afternoon Tea

steps.headline: Choose a sponge cake.
steps.description:
At least one sponge cake is an important addition to an afternoon tea. Some ideas include:
Plain sponge cake
A never fail sponge cake
Chilli chocolate sponge cake
Orange sponge cake
Victoria sponge cake

Spongy chocolate cake.

steps.headline: Try fruit cakes.
steps.description:
There are many possibilities with fruit cakes and they're all a good choice:
Fruit cake
Light glace fruit cake

Scottish whisky dundee fruit cake.

steps.headline: Make a strawberry afternoon tea.Theme the afternoon tea.
steps.description:
Strawberries are a delightful theme for an afternoon tea. Serve the strawberry flavoured tea along with strawberry based cakes such as:{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Choose-Cakes-for-an-Afternoon-Tea-Step-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Choose-Cakes-for-an-Afternoon-Tea-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/57\/Choose-Cakes-for-an-Afternoon-Tea-Step-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Choose-Cakes-for-an-Afternoon-Tea-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Strawberry margarita cake Cherry berry strawberry cake Strawberry bundt cake Canadian flag cake American flag cake Strawberry shortcake. Read: how to serve a strawberry themed afternoon tea.

steps.headline: Make chocolate cakes.
steps.description:
An afternoon tea without a chocolate cake wouldn't feel right! Chocolate cake
Vegan mint chocolate cake
Dense chocolate cake

Crazy chocolate marshmallow cake.

steps.headline: Serve lamingtons.
steps.description:
Lamingtons were invented in Queensland Australia as a way of using up stale cake and making it absolutely delicious again. They're perfect for sharing at an afternoon tea:
Lamingtons

Simple no bake lamingtons.

steps.headline: Serve cupcakes.
steps.description:
Cupcakes are something every afternoon tea party should have. Vegan cupcakes
Cupcake snowman
Red velvet cupcakes
Chocolate cupcake
Banana and chocolate cupcakes
Marbled chocolate cupcakes
Find many more cupcake recipes in wikiHow's cupcakes category.

steps.headline: Choose fairy tale or fantasy cakes.
steps.description:
These sorts of cakes are best for afternoon tea for children or the big-children-at-heart:
Butterfly cakes
Fairy cakes
English fairy cakes
Fairy princess doll cake
Pirate cake
Pirate chocolate biscuit treasure chest cake
Princess cake

Eiffel Tower cake.

text:
Choose a sponge cake. At least one sponge cake is an important addition to an afternoon tea. Some ideas include: Plain sponge cake A never fail sponge cake Chilli chocolate sponge cake Orange sponge cake Victoria sponge cake Spongy chocolate cake. Try fruit cakes. There are many possibilities with fruit cakes and they're all a good choice: Fruit cake Light glace fruit cake Scottish whisky dundee fruit cake. Make a strawberry afternoon tea.Theme the afternoon tea. Strawberries are a delightful theme for an afternoon tea. Read: how to serve a strawberry themed afternoon tea. Make chocolate cakes. An afternoon tea without a chocolate cake wouldn't feel right! Chocolate cake Vegan mint chocolate cake Dense chocolate cake Crazy chocolate marshmallow cake. Serve lamingtons. Lamingtons were invented in Queensland Australia as a way of using up stale cake and making it absolutely delicious again. They're perfect for sharing at an afternoon tea: Lamingtons Simple no bake lamingtons. Serve cupcakes. Cupcakes are something every afternoon tea party should have. Vegan cupcakes Cupcake snowman Red velvet cupcakes Chocolate cupcake Banana and chocolate cupcakes Marbled chocolate cupcakes Find many more cupcake recipes in wikiHow's cupcakes category. Choose fairy tale or fantasy cakes. These sorts of cakes are best for afternoon tea for children or the big-children-at-heart: Butterfly cakes Fairy cakes English fairy cakes Fairy princess doll cake Pirate cake Pirate chocolate biscuit treasure chest cake Princess cake Eiffel Tower cake.
